ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: SetRNG provides utilities to help set and record the setting of the seed and the uniform and normal generators used when a random experiment is run. The utilities can be used in other functions  that do random experiments to simplify recording and/or setting all the  necessary information for reproducibility.  See the vignette and reference manual for examples.

SetRNG provides utilities to help set and record the setting of the seed and the uniform and normal generators used when a random experiment is run. The utilities can be used in other functions  that do random experiments to simplify recording and/or setting all the  necessary information for reproducibility.  See the vignette and reference manual for examples.

name: r-setrng
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2024.2-1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-setrng
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  fn: setRNG_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/setRNG_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/setRNG/setRNG_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: e3b21b08b7db3c2c06543a21718e1c18a2b2d2ddf4c92f0e44841d10f55d5c40

build:
  noarch: generic
  number: 2
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
  run:
    - r-base

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('setRNG')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('setRNG')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://distr.r-forge.r-project.org/
  license: GPL-2
  summary: SetRNG provides utilities to help set and record the setting of the seed and the uniform and normal generators used when a random experiment is run. The utilities can be used in other functions  that do random experiments to simplify recording and/or setting all the  necessary information for reproducibility.  See
    the vignette and reference manual for examples.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file: {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - MathiasHaudgaard
    - FrodePedersen
    - ArneKr
